jobDescription: Location: San Francisco, CA- United States  Job ID: 18WD27033 Position Overview The Design Research Group in the Office of the CTO at Autodesk is focused on discovering new, innovative experiences for designers. We have been working on a large-scale research project, trying to use machine learning and deep learning to redefine Computer-Aided Design (CAD) for people who work in the architecture, engineering and construction (AEC) industry. We believe that human-AI interaction and collaboration can create a paradigm shift for the users to design and create better results more efficiently.  Currently, we have several focused research directions, and Generative Adversarial Networks (GANs) is one of the most important. In the past year, we have looked into numerous GAN structures and applied them for different purposes, and the rich results triggered us to further investigate the potential of it, including the fundamental theories and applications, for example, generating variations, multi-representation translations, and GAN for data types other than images. Therefore, we are seeking for an expert on generative models (GANs and VAEs) who is interested in exploring this new territory with us.
